translated: Inexhaustibility means that the light rays

analyzed: byin rlabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa'i sbyor ba gang zhig gis sems can la bltas na ye shes dbab par 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: yang 'di ltar gsal snang dbab pa las ni dad pa skye bar 'gyur ro /

analyzed: mig sman gyi sbyor ba gsungs pa /

original: yi dags gos ni ma lhung bas //
analyzed: yi dags gos ni ma lhung bas //

original: mar me yi ni sdong bu bya //
analyzed: mar me yi ni sdong bu bya //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji srid du phrag pa las sa la ma lhung pa'i ro'i gos blangs la sdong bu bya ba'o //

analyzed: klu dbang zhes bya ba ni ro nye'o //

analyzed: gtor ma'i gnas zhes bya ba ni dur khrod kyi gnas su'o //

analyzed: du ba dag ni dbab par bya //

original: zhes bya ba ni du ba btang ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni du ba btang ba ste /

original: 'dir bstan pa'i don ni ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i rnal 'byor pas dur khrod dang lam gyi bzhi mdo dang / shing gcig gi drung la sogs par sha dang nya sha la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i gtor ma sngon du 'gro bas thod pa gsum gyi steng du sngar smos pa'i snod dang mar dang sdong bu la sogs pa'i steng na gnas pa'i thod pa bzhag la ye shes
analyzed: 'dir bstan pa'i don ni ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i rnal 'byor pas dur khrod dang lam gyi bzhi mdo dang / shing gcig gi drung la sogs par sha dang nya sha la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i gtor ma sngon du 'gro bas thod pa gsum gyi steng du sngar smos pa'i snod dang mar dang sdong bu la sogs pa'i steng na gnas pa'i thod pa bzhag la ye shes
translated: The meaning taught here is that a yogin of the dakini of Timeless Awareness, having first offered a torma that includes meat and fish, and so on, in a charnel ground, at a crossroads, in front of a solitary tree, and so on, places the skull cups described above on three skull cups and places the skull cup on top of the vessel, the butter lamp, and so on.🔽🔽

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags brgyad brgya zlos shing du ba btang la /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags brgyad brgya zlos shing du ba btang la /
translated: The meaning taught here is that a yogin of the Gnosis ḍākinī, having first made an offering of meat, fish, and so forth, in a charnel ground, at a crossroads, or at the foot of a tree, should place the skull cups described above on top of three skull cups, and on top of the skull cups should place the vessel, oil, wick, and so forth, and recite the Gnosis ḍākinī mantra eight hundred times, and then smoke will arise.

original: yang dur khrod la sogs par gtor ma sngon du 'gro bas du ba des mig la bskus nam mkha' 'gro ma thams cad mthong bar gyur pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: yang dur khrod la sogs par gtor ma sngon du 'gro bas du ba des mig la bskus nam mkha' 'gro ma thams cad mthong bar gyur pa 'di yin no //
translated: Again, in a charnel ground, and so forth, having first made an offering, one should smear one's eyes with that smoke, and one will see all the ḍākinīs.

original: dbye ba'i sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: dbye ba'i sbyor ba gsungs pa /

analyzed: dur khrod kyi sol ba zhes bya ba ni go bar zad do //

original: tsha ba'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tsha ba'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni /

original: ske tshe dang dug dang khrag la sogs pa'o //🔽khro bas bkang ste drud par bya //
analyzed: ske tshe dang dug dang khrag la sogs pa'o // khro bas bkang ste drud par bya //
translated: Mustard seed, poison, blood, and so on.🔽One should drag them, filled with wrath.

original: zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang bcas pa'i sems kyis khem phor gnyis phan tshun du drud pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang bcas pa'i sems kyis khem phor gnyis phan tshun du drud pa'o //
translated: One should drag the two bowls with a mind full of wrath.

original: 'di dag gi don yang ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i rnal 'byor pas gtor ma sngon du 'gro bas zas kyi bya ba byas pa'i kham phor gnyis la ji skad smos pa'i snag tsha dang smyu gus bsgrub bya nyid kyi gzugs bris la de'i snying gar aom ki ri
analyzed: 'di dag gi don yang ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i rnal 'byor pas gtor ma sngon du 'gro bas zas kyi bya ba byas pa'i kham phor gnyis la ji skad smos pa'i snag tsha dang smyu gus bsgrub bya nyid kyi gzugs bris la de'i snying gar aom ki ri
translated: The meaning of these [verses] is as follows: A yogin of the Knowledge Ḍākinī, having performed the food rite with a prior bali offering, draws the form of the victim with the ink and pen as described in the two bowls.

analyzed: ki ri zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi phreng ba bris la /

analyzed: yang @226b gtor ma sngon du 'gro bas khro ba dang bcas pas kham phor drud cing /
translated: Again, with a prior bali offering, one drags the bowls with wrath.

analyzed: aom ka li brta zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: One should recite the mantra beginning with oṃ kali bharta one hundred and eight times. This is it.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //

original: zhi ba'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhi ba'i cho ga gsungs pa /

original: gnyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa la /

translated: This shows that a yogin of the wisdom dakini, having made the bali offering beforehand, should meditate on the goddesses arising from his body, holding vases of nectar, conferring initiation, with a peaceful mind, and he will be pacified.

original: sbyor ba'i gdan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba ni gzhung 'dis gsal snang dbab pa nas 'thab rtsod byung ba'i bar du gsal bar ston par byed pas na rab tu byed pa'o //

translated: With the seat of union, etc., composition is that which clearly shows, by this text, from the descent of the clear light up to the arising of the conflict.

analyzed: dpal gdan bzhi pa'i 'grel pa dran pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba las sbyor ba'i gdan gyi rim par phye ba ste gsum pa'o /

analyzed: // / da ni rdo rje dang dril bu rnam par dag pas shes rab thabs kyi mnyam par sbyor ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to teach the union of wisdom and means by the purity of the vajra and bell, it is said:

analyzed: gnyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gnyis med sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The nondual union is the union of method and wisdom as nondual.

original: snying po ni dam pa ste nyan par 'tshal zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //🔽gnyis med ming gis brjod pa yin //
analyzed: snying po ni dam pa ste nyan par 'tshal zhes bya ba dang 'brel to // gnyis med ming gis brjod pa yin //
translated: The essence is the best, in connection with we wish to hear.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The nondual is expressed by the name nondual.

original: ming ni tha snyad du bya ba ste /
analyzed: ming ni tha snyad du bya ba ste /
translated: Name is the conventional term,

original: brjod pa ni des brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni des brjod par bya'o //
translated: and expression is what is expressed by that.

analyzed: sbyor ba ji ltar brtsam bgyi ba // zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nyams su blang ba bya ba ste /
translated: How should one undertake the practice?

analyzed: de ltar na gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba'i snying po la gnyis su med pa'i ming gis ni ji ltar brjod //
translated: Thus, in the essence of the nondual union, how is the nondual expressed by the name?

original: ngo bo nyid ni ci 'dra /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ci 'dra /
translated: What is its nature?

original: nyams su ni ji ltar blang bar bgyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams su ni ji ltar blang bar bgyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How should it be practiced? This is the meaning.

original: lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: lan gsungs pa /
translated: The answer is given:

analyzed: gnyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa la gnyis med sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The nondual union, etc. The nondual union has been explained.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Thatness is its nature.

original: nyon cig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyon cig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Listen is connected with that.

original: yang dag ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: Correct means unmistaken.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He states that:

analyzed: rdo rje dril bu phyag rgya dag / so sor gzung ba'i de kho na //
translated: The reality of the vajra, bell, and mudra,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: each is to be grasped.

original: de kho na nyid ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra rnam par dag pa dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra rnam par dag pa dbyer med pa ste /
translated: Reality is the indivisibility of the purity of the sound of the perfection of wisdom, which is the indivisibility of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de lta bu'i rdo rje dang dril bu gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdo rje dang dril bu gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Such a vajra and bell are to be grasped.

original: gzung ba ni bsgom pa ste de @227a * //
analyzed: gzung ba ni bsgom pa ste de @227a * //
translated: Grasping is meditation.

original: ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra rnam par dag pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden par dbyer med pa'i rdo rje dang dril bu'i de kho na nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra rnam par dag pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden par dbyer med pa'i rdo rje dang dril bu'i de kho na nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that the reality of the vajra and bell, which is the indivisibility of the purity of the sound of the perfection of wisdom and the conventional truth, should be meditated upon.

original: phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni dril bu rnam par dag pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni dril bu rnam par dag pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Mudra is the wisdom that is the purity of the bell.

original: de yang phyi dang nang gi shes rab gnyis so ;
analyzed: de yang phyi dang nang gi shes rab gnyis so ;
translated: Moreover, there are two kinds of wisdom, outer and inner.

original: / so so zhes bya ba ni thabs te /
analyzed: / so so zhes bya ba ni thabs te /
translated: The term “each” refers to the method.

original: de yang phyi dang nang gi dbye ba gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang phyi dang nang gi dbye ba gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, there are two kinds of method, outer and inner.

original: yang na phyag rgya ni gnyis su med par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: yang na phyag rgya ni gnyis su med par sbyor ba ste /
translated: Or else, the seal is the union of nonduality.

original: de yang phyi rol gyi skyes pa dang bud med kyi las kyi phyag rgya mnyam par sbyor ba dang / nang gi chos nyid dang dngos po mnyam par sbyor ba dang / ye shes kyi snying rje dang stong pa nyid mnyam par sbyor ba'o //

translated: Moreover, there is the union of the outer karma-mudra, the male and female, and the union of the inner reality and entity, and the union of the emptiness and compassion of gnosis.

original: de nyid ni de kho na ste so sor gzung ba ni yang dag par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni de kho na ste so sor gzung ba ni yang dag par gzung ba'o //
translated: That itself is reality, and the grasping of each is the correct grasping.

original: yang na rdo rje dang dril bu ni phyi rol gyi thabs dang shes rab po //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje dang dril bu ni phyi rol gyi thabs dang shes rab po //
translated: Or else, the vajra and bell are the outer method and wisdom.

original: de nyid ni phyag rgya ste so sor dga' bas 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni phyag rgya ste so sor dga' bas 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the seal, because it is impressed with the joy of each.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dril bu la rdo rjes steng du mtshan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dril bu la rdo rjes steng du mtshan pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, the bell is marked with the vajra above.

original: yang na phyag rgya ni de gnyis mnyam par sbyor ba las byung ba'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: yang na phyag rgya ni de gnyis mnyam par sbyor ba las byung ba'i bde ba ste /
translated: Or, the seal is the bliss that arises from the union of those two.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the very essence of the innate.

original: de dag thams cad bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag thams cad bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach all of those,

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “That very vajra,” and so on.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni rang gi lus te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni rang gi lus te /
translated: “ Self” means one’s own body,

original: gzhan shes rab la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan shes rab la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on the other, namely, wisdom.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje ste shes rab dang dbyer med par sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thabs la yang rdo rje'i sgras brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje ste shes rab dang dbyer med par sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thabs la yang rdo rje'i sgras brjod par bya ste /
translated: “ That very vajra” means that the method is also to be called “vajra,” because it is united inseparably with wisdom.

original: shes rab dang dbyer mi phyed par mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir te rdo rje dang chos mthun par dgongs so //
analyzed: shes rab dang dbyer mi phyed par mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir te rdo rje dang chos mthun par dgongs so //
translated: It is intended that the vajra is similar to the method, because it is united inseparably with wisdom.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni mang ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni mang ba'o //
translated: Or, “also” means “many.”

original: dza zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: dza zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa ste /
translated: “ Ja” means “beautiful.”

original: thabs 'dis shes rab du ma mdzes par byas pas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: thabs 'dis shes rab du ma mdzes par byas pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra is beautiful because it makes many wisdoms beautiful with this method.

original: gnyis par na bdag ces bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis par na bdag ces bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: “ Self” means the conventional truth.

original: de nyid ni rnam par dpyad na /
analyzed: de nyid ni rnam par dpyad na /
translated: That itself, when analyzed,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i mthar thug pas rdo rje ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i mthar thug pas rdo rje ste /
translated: is the ultimate truth, and thus is a vajra,🔽because it has the characteristic of being indivisible.

original: mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid can pas rdo rje zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid can pas rdo rje zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called a vajra,

original: de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid do //
translated: and it is thatness.

original: de bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pa yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pa yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the ultimate truth is not separate from the conventional truth.

original: de kho na nyid kyis dbyer med par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyis dbyer med par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: It should be grasped as being inseparable from thatness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For that very reason, it is said, “the Dharma and so on.”

original: de la chos zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa ste /
translated: There, the Dharma is the aggregates and so on,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir @227b ro ;
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir @227b ro ;
translated: because they hold their own characteristics, such as impermanence and so on.

original: / dril bu zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid de /
analyzed: / dril bu zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid de /
translated: The bell is the naturally pure reality,

original: des thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accomplished by that.

original: yang na chos kyang chos kyang yin la dril bu yang yin pas chos kyi dril bu ste chos nyid do //
analyzed: yang na chos kyang chos kyang yin la dril bu yang yin pas chos kyi dril bu ste chos nyid do //
translated: Or, it is the Dharma and it is a bell, and thus it is the Dharma bell, which is reality.

original: de nyid ni lha mo ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni lha mo ste /
translated: She is the goddess,

original: de kho na nyid 'dis rnal 'byor pa rnams la chos thams cad gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid 'dis rnal 'byor pa rnams la chos thams cad gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by this reality she illuminates all things for the yogins.

original: kha sbyar sbyor ba phyag rgya ste //
analyzed: kha sbyar sbyor ba phyag rgya ste //
translated: The seal is the union of the two organs.

original: zhes bya ba la kha sbyar zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus dang / las kyi phyag rgya mnyam par sbyor ba dang / don dam pa'i bden pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la kha sbyar zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus dang / las kyi phyag rgya mnyam par sbyor ba dang / don dam pa'i bden pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The union of the two organs is the union of one's own body with the karmamudra, and the union of the ultimate and superficial realities.

original: de nyid ni phyag rgya ste phan tshun mi phyed par dkris pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de nyid ni phyag rgya ste phan tshun mi phyed par dkris pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: That is the seal, because they are bound together without separation.

original: / de dag gis ni shin tu dbyer med par bstan to //
analyzed: / de dag gis ni shin tu dbyer med par bstan to //
translated: They are taught to be inseparable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: thabs ni de ru thim pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thabs ni de ru thim pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the method dissolves into that.

original: de ru zhes bya ba ni shes rab la ste las kyi phyag rgya'i shes rab la bdag gi lus 'khyud pa'i tshul du thim pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab kyi sems la kun rdzob kyi sems sam bdag dang gzhan dbyer med par thim pa dang /
analyzed: de ru zhes bya ba ni shes rab la ste las kyi phyag rgya'i shes rab la bdag gi lus 'khyud pa'i tshul du thim pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab kyi sems la kun rdzob kyi sems sam bdag dang gzhan dbyer med par thim pa dang /
translated: In that, means in wisdom, in the wisdom of the karma consort, one’s body dissolves in the manner of embracing, and the relative mind dissolves into the connate mind, or oneself and the other become inseparable.

original: stong pa nyid la snying rje dang don dam pa la kun rdzob thim pas na dril bu ma gtogs par rdo rje 'ba' zhig gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la snying rje dang don dam pa la kun rdzob thim pas na dril bu ma gtogs par rdo rje 'ba' zhig gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: Since emptiness dissolves into compassion and the ultimate dissolves into the relative, one should not hold only the vajra, excluding the bell.

original: dril bur rdo rje thim pa'i de kho na nyid kyi phyag rgya gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: dril bur rdo rje thim pa'i de kho na nyid kyi phyag rgya gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that one should hold the reality seal in which the vajra dissolves into the bell.

original: / de la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa de yang 'dir stong pa nyid kyis sbyangs pa'i lha'i sku'i ting nge 'dzin te gnas der dang po ci zhig bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / de la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa de yang 'dir stong pa nyid kyis sbyangs pa'i lha'i sku'i ting nge 'dzin te gnas der dang po ci zhig bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, the nonduality of the two truths, relative and ultimate, is here the meditative concentration of the deity’s form purified by emptiness. In order to demonstrate what should be done first in that place,

original: dang por re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dang por re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it says “first of all,” and so on.

original: dang por zhes bya ba ni thog mar te ;
analyzed: dang por zhes bya ba ni thog mar te ;
translated: First means initially.

original: rnal 'byor gyi thog mar /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi thog mar /
translated: At the beginning of yoga.

original: rdo rje thal mo dam bcings nas //
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo dam bcings nas //
translated: Having bound the vajra palms.

original: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with the above.

original: re zhig ces bya ba ni rim gyi don to /
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba ni rim gyi don to /
translated: For a while means gradually.

original: rab dang dra ba la sogs pa dag pa bshad par bya ba yin pa las de dag gzhag ste /
analyzed: rab dang dra ba la sogs pa dag pa bshad par bya ba yin pa las de dag gzhag ste /
translated: The purities of the web and so on are to be explained, but they are set aside.

original: dag pa gsum brjod par bya ba bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dag pa gsum brjod par bya ba bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The three purities are to be expressed and explained. This is the meaning.

original: yang na sgrub pa po dag pa rnams kyi nang nas dag pa gsum brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na sgrub pa po dag pa rnams kyi nang nas dag pa gsum brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, from among the pure adepts, the three purities are to be expressed. This is the meaning.

original: dag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni don to //🔽brjod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i sngags gdon pa ste stong pa nyid bsgoms nas /
analyzed: dag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni don to // brjod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i sngags gdon pa ste stong pa nyid bsgoms nas /
translated: The pure ones is the meaning.🔽To express is to recite their mantras.

original: aom sva bh'a wa zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod @228a * //
analyzed: aom sva bh'a wa zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod @228a * //
translated: Having meditated on emptiness, one should recite Oṃ svabhāva.

original: par bya'o // sa bon las byung ba'i rdo rje bsgoms nas aom badzra zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: par bya'o // sa bon las byung ba'i rdo rje bsgoms nas aom badzra zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having meditated on the vajra arisen from the seed, one should recite Oṃ vajra.

original: lha'i gzugs su bskyed nas aom yo ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //🔽de ltar rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnam par dag pa bstan nas ra ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha'i gzugs su bskyed nas aom yo ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o // de ltar rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnam par dag pa bstan nas ra ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having generated the deity form, one should recite “oṃ yoga” and so forth.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having thus taught the purity of yoga tantra, in order to teach the purity of the enclosure and so forth, [the Bhagavān] declares, “grasping and grasped,” and so on.

original: sngags dang lha la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi kun rdzob dang stong pa nyid kyi don dam par dbyer med pa las dgos pa'i dbang gis gnyis su sprul pa la /
analyzed: sngags dang lha la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi kun rdzob dang stong pa nyid kyi don dam par dbyer med pa las dgos pa'i dbang gis gnyis su sprul pa la /
translated: From the non-duality of the conventional, the characteristics of mantra, deity, and so on, and the ultimate, emptiness, emanated as two by the power of necessity,

original: gzugs la sogs pa las rnam par grol bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las rnam par grol bar ston pa ni /
translated: the teaching of liberation from form and so on is

original: sbyin pa ste chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ste chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: generosity, the gift of Dharma.

original: yang na dngos po rnams su 'dzin pa stong pa nyid du btang ba ni chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na dngos po rnams su 'dzin pa stong pa nyid du btang ba ni chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the gift of Dharma is the giving of grasping things as real into emptiness.

original: de'i rnam par dag pas ra ba'o //🔽thams cad rtsva bzhin gtang bar bya //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pas ra ba'o // thams cad rtsva bzhin gtang bar bya //
translated: Its purity is the enclosure.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Everything should be given up like grass.”

original: thams cad ni nor dang nor gyi mchog dang / yan lag dang yan lag gi mchog ste /
analyzed: thams cad ni nor dang nor gyi mchog dang / yan lag dang yan lag gi mchog ste /
translated: All refers to wealth and the best of wealth, and to limbs and the best of limbs.

original: zang zing rnams so //
analyzed: zang zing rnams so //
translated: They are material things.

original: rtsva zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste mchil snabs la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtsva zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste mchil snabs la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Grass is a metaphor; it should be understood to include saliva and so on.

original: ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: rnal 'byor ldan pa'i sems kyis ni //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ldan pa'i sems kyis ni // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The one who is endowed with the yoga of mind🔽The one who is endowed with the yoga of mind is the one who has that mind.

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba las ni gtong pa po dang / len pa po dang / sbyin pa rnam pa gsum mi dmigs shing mnyam par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba las ni gtong pa po dang / len pa po dang / sbyin pa rnam pa gsum mi dmigs shing mnyam par sbyor ba ste /
translated: Yoga is the non-apprehension of the giver, the receiver, and the three kinds of giving, and the union with equality.

original: de'i sems gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sems gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who has that mind is called that.

original: de dag dang / gzhan mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag dang / gzhan mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ste /
translated: And others refers to the giving of fearlessness.

original: chos dang zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa gsum rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa gsum rab ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos dang zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa gsum rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa gsum rab ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The three pure gifts are the three gifts of Dharma, material things, and fearlessness.

original: dri ma'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: dri ma'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purity of stains is stated:

original: sems can kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: To all sentient beings, etc.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni 'jigs pa rnams las skyob pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni 'jigs pa rnams las skyob pa ste /
translated: The gift of fearlessness is the protection of those who are afraid.

original: de yang sngar smos pa ltar mi dmigs pa dang sbyar ro ;
analyzed: de yang sngar smos pa ltar mi dmigs pa dang sbyar ro ;
translated: And that is to be applied to nonapprehension as previously explained.

original: /'dis ni dge ba'i chos la 'jug pas dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims bstan te /
analyzed: /'dis ni dge ba'i chos la 'jug pas dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims bstan te /
translated: This shows the morality of gathering virtuous qualities, since it engages in virtuous qualities.

original: sbyin pa'i yan lag tu 'ang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i yan lag tu 'ang blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is also to be regarded as a branch of generosity.

original: sdom pa'i bdag nyid kyi sdig pa las ldog pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdom pa'i bdag nyid kyi sdig pa las ldog pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the morality of turning away from sin, which is the nature of restraint, he says:

original: 'gro rnams gtso bor mi bya sogs //🔽zhes bya @228b ste ;
analyzed: 'gro rnams gtso bor mi bya sogs // zhes bya @228b ste ;
translated: One should not be the chief in the world, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi dge ba las ldog pa gzhan yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi dge ba las ldog pa gzhan yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes other turnings away from nonvirtue.

original: gzhan gyi don spyod pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don spyod pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the morality of engaging in the welfare of others, he says:

original: sems can don ni dgag mi bya //
analyzed: sems can don ni dgag mi bya //
translated: One should not block the welfare of sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te go sla'o //
translated: This is easy to understand.

original: de dag gis cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gis cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of these?

original: steng du tshul khrims dra ba'o //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: steng du tshul khrims dra ba'o //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Above is the net of morality.

original: tshul khrims gsum rnam par dag pa'i dra bas steng nas g-yog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshul khrims gsum rnam par dag pa'i dra bas steng nas g-yog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is covered above with the net of the three pure moralities.

original: phur bu'i rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phur bu'i rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the purity of the stake, he says:

original: gzhan la gnod pa'i 'gog pa la sogs //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa'i 'gog pa la sogs // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The prevention of harm to others, etc.

original: gzhan la gnod pa ni gzhan la gnod pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa ni gzhan la gnod pa byed pa ste /
translated: Harm to others is the harm done to others.

original: 'gog pa ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: Prevention is the turning away from that.

original: des ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa bstan no //
analyzed: des ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa bstan no //
translated: This shows the patience of accepting suffering.

original: yang na gzhan gyis gnod pa zhes bya bar sbyar te gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa ci yang mi snyam pa'i bzod pa bstan te /
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis gnod pa zhes bya bar sbyar te gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa ci yang mi snyam pa'i bzod pa bstan te /
translated: Or else, it is to be connected with the harm done by others, and shows the patience of not thinking about anything done by others to harm one.

original: gsum pa'i don gyis gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa'i don gyis gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The third is the meaning of the second.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni chos nyid zab mo la bzod pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni chos nyid zab mo la bzod pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word etc. includes the patience with the profound reality, etc.

original: des ni bzod pa rnam pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bzod pa rnam pa gsum bstan to //
translated: This shows the three kinds of patience.

original: de sa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de sa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: bzod pa'i phur bu 'og tu btab //🔽ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bzod pa'i phur bu 'og tu btab //🔽ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The stake of patience is driven in below.

original: sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mtshan rnams bzod pas 'og tu mnan pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mtshan rnams bzod pas 'og tu mnan pa ste /
translated: subjugated by patience, by enduring suffering and the reasons for suffering.

original: bzod pa rnam par dag pa'i phur bu 'og tu gdab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzod pa rnam par dag pa'i phur bu 'og tu gdab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should drive down the stake of pure patience.🔽What is the purpose of those three?

original: gsum po de dag gis ci zhig bya zhe na /🔽phur bu ra ba dra ba yis //
analyzed: gsum po de dag gis ci zhig bya zhe na / phur bu ra ba dra ba yis //
translated: The text

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: says, “with the stake, the fence, and the net,” and so on.🔽The “hostile

original: sdang ba'i bdud ces bya ba ni 'dis lus la sogs pa sun 'byin par byed /
analyzed: sdang ba'i bdud ces bya ba ni 'dis lus la sogs pa sun 'byin par byed /
translated: demons” are so called because they cause harm to the body and so on.

original: rnam par sgyur bar byed pas na sdang ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par sgyur bar byed pas na sdang ba ste /
translated: They are hostile because they cause harm and transformation.🔽They are the🔽demons of the afflictions, of the aggregates, of the Lord of Death, and of

original: nyon mongs pa dang phung po dang 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'i bdud rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang phung po dang 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'i bdud rnams so //
translated: the sons of the gods.

original: de dag nyid dgra ste bde ba 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid dgra ste bde ba 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are enemies because they destroy happiness.🔽They are to be

original: bskrad pa ni bzlog pa ste de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskrad pa ni bzlog pa ste de'i phyir ro //
translated: expelled because they are to be turned away.🔽But aren’t the net and so on

original: ci ste dra ba la sogs pa rang gi sems kyis sprul pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ci ste dra ba la sogs pa rang gi sems kyis sprul pa ma yin nam /
translated: emanated by one’s own mind?

original: des ci ltar bzlog par 'gyur zhe na /🔽bdud ni bdud du byed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: des ci ltar bzlog par 'gyur zhe na / bdud ni bdud du byed mi 'gyur //
translated: How can they be turned away?🔽The text

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: says, “The demon will not be able to act as a demon.”

original: bdud ces bya ba ni sngar smos pa rnams so //
analyzed: bdud ces bya ba ni sngar smos pa rnams so //
translated: The “demons” are those mentioned previously.

original: bdud du byed mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdud du byed mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “They will not become demons” means

original: de dag gis 'tshe bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis 'tshe bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: they will not be harmed by them.

original: 'dir dgongs pa ni dra ba la sogs pa sems kyis byas pa de'i tshe bdud @229a * //
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa ni dra ba la sogs pa sems kyis byas pa de'i tshe bdud @229a * //
translated: The idea here is that when the net and so on are created by the mind,

original: kyang sems kyis byas pa yin pas bdud nyid gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyang sems kyis byas pa yin pas bdud nyid gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since the demons are also created by the mind, the demons themselves do not exist separately.

original: ji ltar de dag gis 'tshe bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag gis 'tshe bar 'gyur te /
translated: How can they harm?

original: 'tshe ba ni de dag la rag las pa yin la /
analyzed: 'tshe ba ni de dag la rag las pa yin la /
translated: Harm depends on them.

original: bdud rnams med na de dag gis ji ltar 'tshe bar 'gyur snyam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: bdud rnams med na de dag gis ji ltar 'tshe bar 'gyur snyam pa 'di yin no //
translated: If the demons do not exist, how can they harm?

original: 'on te bdud rnams dang des byas pa'i sdul  bsngal nyams su myong bzhin du yang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu rnam par mi 'ong ngo snyam na /🔽rang gi sems kyis bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te bdud rnams dang des byas pa'i sdul  bsngal nyams su myong bzhin du yang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu rnam par mi 'ong ngo snyam na / rang gi sems kyis bsdams pa'o //
translated: But if the demons and the suffering they create are experienced, it is quite unreasonable to say that they do not exist.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “They are restrained by their own minds.”

original: de'i tshe nyams su myong ba'i phyir thams cad rang gi sems yin par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyams su myong ba'i phyir thams cad rang gi sems yin par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: At that time, because of the experience, one should establish that everything is one’s own mind.

original: phyi rol gyi ni rigs pas gnod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni rigs pas gnod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the logical refutation of external objects,

original: don du mi rung ngo zhes khong nas 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: don du mi rung ngo zhes khong nas 'byung bar bya'o //
translated: one should understand that they are not suitable as objects.

original: des kyang cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des kyang cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of that?

original: bsdams pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsdams pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “one is restrained.”

original: ji ltar bdud la sogs pa sems kyis sprul cing nyams su myong bar yod pa ltar dra ba la sogs pas bcings pa dang / dgra rnams bskrad pa yang nyams su myong bar legs par 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdud la sogs pa sems kyis sprul cing nyams su myong bar yod pa ltar dra ba la sogs pas bcings pa dang / dgra rnams bskrad pa yang nyams su myong bar legs par 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Just as the experience of being bound by a net, etc., and the experience of driving away enemies, which are emanated by the mind, such as Māra, are well established.

original: / de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rang gi sems ni btul ba na //
analyzed: / de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / rang gi sems ni btul ba na //
translated: In order to demonstrate that,🔽it is said:🔽How can there be harm from Māra

original: bdud kyis 'tshe bar ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdud kyis 'tshe bar ga la 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: when one’s own mind is disciplined?

original: sems btul ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems btul ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One’s own mind is disciplined

original: rang gi rang bzhin shes pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin shes pa ste /
translated: when one knows one’s own nature.

original: rang bzhin shes pas nyon mongs pa rnams thul bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang bzhin shes pas nyon mongs pa rnams thul bar 'gyur la /
translated: By knowing one’s nature, the afflictions are disciplined.

original: nyon mongs pa'i zhags pa dang bral na //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i zhags pa dang bral na //
translated: If one is free from the noose of afflictions,

original: bdud gzhan yang ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdud gzhan yang ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: other māras will also be averted,

original: de dag ni de'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are rooted in that.

original: 'di dag gis ni rang bzhin shes na dra ba la sogs pa med pa ltar bdud kyang med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni rang bzhin shes na dra ba la sogs pa med pa ltar bdud kyang med pa yin la /
translated: By these, it is shown that if one knows the nature, then just as there are no nets, etc., there are no māras.

original: nyams su myong bar bdud rnams yod pa ltar dra ba la sogs pa yod pas srung ba phun sum tshogs pa legs par gnas pa'o zhes ston te /
analyzed: nyams su myong bar bdud rnams yod pa ltar dra ba la sogs pa yod pas srung ba phun sum tshogs pa legs par gnas pa'o zhes ston te /
translated: And just as the māras are experienced as existing, the nets, etc., exist, so the excellent protection is well-established.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: ji ltar chu la chu blugs pa //
analyzed: ji ltar chu la chu blugs pa //
translated: Just as water poured into water

original: ro gcig tu ni gyur pa bzhin //
analyzed: ro gcig tu ni gyur pa bzhin //
translated: becomes of one taste,

original: sems nyid skyon yon 'byung gnas pas //
analyzed: sems nyid skyon yon 'byung gnas pas //
translated: since the mind itself is the source of faults and virtues,

original: mi mthun gnyen po gang la yod //🔽ces bya'o // da ni bsam gtan gyi gnas su mandala gru bzhi pa dri yis byug pa'i rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun gnyen po gang la yod // ces bya'o // da ni bsam gtan gyi gnas su mandala gru bzhi pa dri yis byug pa'i rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: what is the incompatible antidote?

original: mnyam nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mnyam nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the purity of the four-sided maṇḍala anointed with scent in the place of concentration, [the Bhagavān] declares the equality, etc., of all phenomena.

original: mnyam nyid sems zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i sems dang / @229b sems las byung ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing mnyam pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mnyam nyid sems zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i sems dang / @229b sems las byung ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing mnyam pa nyid yin te /
translated: The “mind of sameness” is the mind and mental factors of the three realms, which are naturally luminous and the same.

original: sems mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa des dri'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi par byug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa des dri'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi par byug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should anoint the mandala of fragrance with that purity of the sameness of mind.

original: me tog dgram pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: me tog dgram pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purity of scattering flowers is stated:

original: lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “On the body” and so forth.

original: gang gi lus la ste'us 'jog pa dang / tsandan gyis byug pa dag yod pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gi lus la ste'us 'jog pa dang / tsandan gyis byug pa dag yod pa de ni /
translated: One who has a body anointed with sandalwood and smeared with sesame seeds

original: lus la ste'u 'jog tsandan byugs te gnyi ga la chags pa dang sdang ba med par sems snyoms pa de ni sems mnyam par gnas pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: lus la ste'u 'jog tsandan byugs te gnyi ga la chags pa dang sdang ba med par sems snyoms pa de ni sems mnyam par gnas pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: is impartial, with an equal mind, without attachment and aversion to both. That is the patience of abiding in an equal mind.

original: bzod pa rnam par dag pa des rnal 'byor pas me tog dgram pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa rnam par dag pa des rnal 'byor pas me tog dgram pa'o //
translated: With that purity of patience, the yogi should scatter flowers.

original: bdug spos kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bdug spos kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purity of incense is stated:

original: mnyam nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mnyam nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Sameness” and so forth.

original: rnam par dag pa rang bzhin dag pa zhes bya ba ni sva bh'a wa shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sva bha wa shuddho& ham zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rang bzhin dag pa zhes bya ba ni sva bh'a wa shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sva bha wa shuddho& ham zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The purification called “natural purity” is svabhāvaśuddhaḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāvaśuddho’haṃ.

original: des mnyam pa nyid du rnam par dag pa'i bdug pas bdugs pa'o //
analyzed: des mnyam pa nyid du rnam par dag pa'i bdug pas bdugs pa'o //
translated: By that, one fumigates with the incense of equality purification.

original: mar me'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: mar me'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purification of the lamp is stated:

original: shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽shes rab mar me zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa la / shes rab mar me zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Insight” and so on.

original: shes rab rnam par dag pa'i mar me ste /
analyzed: shes rab rnam par dag pa'i mar me ste /
translated: The lamp of insight is the lamp of the purification of insight.

original: de spar bar bya zhes bya ba lhag ma yin na //
analyzed: de spar bar bya zhes bya ba lhag ma yin na //
translated: The rest is “one should light it.”

original: khams gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi mar mes khams gsum gyi mun pa bcom nas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du de kho na nyid kyi lam gsal bar snang bar byed de /
analyzed: khams gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi mar mes khams gsum gyi mun pa bcom nas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du de kho na nyid kyi lam gsal bar snang bar byed de /
translated: The three realms and so on: the lamp of insight, having conquered the darkness of the three realms, illuminates the path of reality as one wishes.

original: rnam par dag pa de dang sbyar ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa de dang sbyar ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is intended that one should apply that purification.

original: de dag gis ni bsam gtan rtsom pa na rnam par dag pa 'di dag gis sngon du dag par bya'o zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni bsam gtan rtsom pa na rnam par dag pa 'di dag gis sngon du dag par bya'o zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: These indicate that when one begins meditation, one should first purify oneself with these purities.

original: bdag gis sgrub thabs kyi nang du gsal bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: bdag gis sgrub thabs kyi nang du gsal bar bshad zin to //
translated: I have explained them clearly in the Sādhana.

original: gzhung nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhung nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the summary of the treatise, he says, “with the mind, etc. ”

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag gis sems can thams cad bde ba la dgod par bya zhing mchod pa'i dus dang / gtor ma'i dus su rnam par dag pa de dag rab tu sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag gis sems can thams cad bde ba la dgod par bya zhing mchod pa'i dus dang / gtor ma'i dus su rnam par dag pa de dag rab tu sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should establish all sentient beings in happiness with those gifts of fearlessness, etc., and one should apply those purities at the time of worship and at the time of the sacrificial rite.

original: bsam gtan rtsom pa'i gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan rtsom pa'i gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The excellence of the place for beginning meditation is taught.

original: yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: “Pleasant, etc. ” is easy to understand.

original: de dag gis ni @230a * //
analyzed: de dag gis ni @230a * //
translated: By these,

original: bsam gtan rtsom pa thams cad kyi thun mong gi bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: bsam gtan rtsom pa thams cad kyi thun mong gi bya ba bstan to //
translated: the common activity for all who begin meditation is taught.

original: da ni gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes bskyed par bya ba'i phyir thabs dang shes rab kyi sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes bskyed par bya ba'i phyir thabs dang shes rab kyi sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to generate the connate pristine awareness, the nature of the nondual yoga, the union of means and wisdom is taught.

original: bdag gi nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: bdag gi nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: One’s own nature and so forth.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni sgrub pa po'i rang gi lus so //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni sgrub pa po'i rang gi lus so //
translated: One’s own body is the practitioner.

original: rdo rje bskyed nas su zhes bya ba ni rdo rje las byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpar bskyed par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bskyed nas su zhes bya ba ni rdo rje las byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpar bskyed par bya ba ste /
translated: Having generated the vajra, one should generate oneself as Vajrasattva arisen from the vajra.

original: sngar bstan pa'i gnas su 'dug nas rdo rje thal mo snying gar bcings te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i gnas su 'dug nas rdo rje thal mo snying gar bcings te /
translated: Having sat in the previously described position, one should bind the vajra palms at the heart.

original: dag pa rnam gsum brjod nas stong pa nyid bsgoms la /
analyzed: dag pa rnam gsum brjod nas stong pa nyid bsgoms la /
translated: Having recited the three purities, one should meditate on emptiness.

original: ri rab kyi rtse mo'i grong khyer du seng ge dang zla ba'i stan la bdag nyid h'um las byung ba'i rdo rjes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: ri rab kyi rtse mo'i grong khyer du seng ge dang zla ba'i stan la bdag nyid h'um las byung ba'i rdo rjes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: On the seat of a lion and moon on the peak of Mount Meru in the city, one should generate oneself as Vajrasattva arisen from the syllable hūṃ and the vajra.

original: shes rab dril bu zhes byar sprul //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab dril bu zhes byar sprul // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should emanate wisdom as a bell.

original: shes rab ni bu mo'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni bu mo'o //
translated: Wisdom is a girl.

original: dril bu zhes byar sprul zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dril bu zhes byar sprul zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The bell is called “emanation.”

original: aa las byung ba'i dril bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par bsgom mo //
analyzed: aa las byung ba'i dril bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par bsgom mo //
translated: The bell that arises from the letter A is meditated on as the perfection of wisdom.

original: bar du khru gang bzhag nas ni //
analyzed: bar du khru gang bzhag nas ni //
translated: Having placed it between one’s eyebrows,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: in the above verse,

original: bar zhes bya ba ni bdag dang shes rab kyi bar du ste /
analyzed: bar zhes bya ba ni bdag dang shes rab kyi bar du ste /
translated: “between” means between oneself and the perfection of wisdom.

original: bdag gi mdun du khru gang tsam gyis bar chod par shes par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi mdun du khru gang tsam gyis bar chod par shes par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the bell as being in front of oneself, at a distance of one cubit.

original: mnyam nyid blta bas gnas par bya //
analyzed: mnyam nyid blta bas gnas par bya //
translated: One should look at it with equanimity.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag dang shes rab gnyis phan tshun thad kar gnas pa la gcig la gcig gdong bltas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag dang shes rab gnyis phan tshun thad kar gnas pa la gcig la gcig gdong bltas pa'o //
translated: The two, oneself and the perfection of wisdom, are situated in front of each other, facing each other.

original: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir //🔽snying gar h'um ni bsgom byas la //
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir // snying gar h'um ni bsgom byas la //
translated: In order to explain that in detail,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the verse says,

original: snying gar h'um ni bsgom byas la //
analyzed: snying gar h'um ni bsgom byas la //
translated: “One should meditate on the syllable hūṃ at the heart.”

original: zhes bya ba ni mchod pa dang gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa byas pa'i 'og tu snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge h'um bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchod pa dang gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa byas pa'i 'og tu snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge h'um bsgom pa'o //
translated: “One should meditate on the syllable hūṃ at the heart” means that after one has made offerings and gone for refuge in the Three Jewels and so forth, one should meditate on the syllable hūṃ on a moon disc at the heart.

original: de nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Then, what should be done?

original: thams cad rig pas kun stong zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thams cad rig pas kun stong zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Everything is known, and all is empty is stated.

original: h'um gi me lce'i 'od kyis reg pa tsam gyis khams gsum po ma lus pa rnams stong pa nyid du bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: h'um gi me lce'i 'od kyis reg pa tsam gyis khams gsum po ma lus pa rnams stong pa nyid du bsgom pa'o //
translated: By merely touching the flame of the fire of the hūṃ, one should meditate on the entire three realms as emptiness.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir khams gsum zhes bya ba smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir khams gsum zhes bya ba smos te go sla'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, the three realms is stated, which is easy to understand.

original: sngon bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As before is

original: phung po la sogs pa stong pa nyid du sngar bstan pa'i tshul dran par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa stong pa nyid du sngar bstan pa'i tshul dran par byed pa'o //
translated: to recall the method of previously teaching the aggregates and so on as emptiness.

original: gzhal yas khang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhal yas khang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the celestial mansion,

original: mnyam nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mnyam nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the equality and so on is stated.

original: pho brang zhes bya ba la sogs @230b pa ni /
analyzed: pho brang zhes bya ba la sogs @230b pa ni /
translated: The palace and so on

original: gzhal yas khang ngo //
analyzed: gzhal yas khang ngo //
translated: is the celestial mansion.

original: yangs pa ci 'dod par zhes pa ni rgya khyon ji snyed 'dod par ro //
analyzed: yangs pa ci 'dod par zhes pa ni rgya khyon ji snyed 'dod par ro //
translated: As vast as one wishes is as much as one desires in terms of size.

original: sngar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsgoms pa'i h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsgoms pa'i h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the characteristics of the vajra that arises from the hūṃ previously meditated upon above the moon maṇḍala,🔽the vajra is stated.

original: lha ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lha ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The deity and so on is stated.

original: 'di'i don ni rim par phye ba sngar thal ba las bstan pa'i lha nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rjer bsgom mo zhes bya ba 'di yin no //🔽'od zer sna tshogs 'bar ba yi //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni rim par phye ba sngar thal ba las bstan pa'i lha nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rjer bsgom mo zhes bya ba 'di yin no // 'od zer sna tshogs 'bar ba yi //
translated: The meaning of this is that one should meditate on the vajra consecrated by the twenty-eight deities previously explained in the commentary.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rdo rje'i sa bon h'um gi khyad par ston pa yin te /🔽'dis kyang seng ge dang zla ba'i steng na gnas pa'i sa bon h'um gi thig le las 'od zer sna tshogs spros nas khams gsum pa la reg ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rdo rje'i sa bon h'um gi khyad par ston pa yin te / 'dis kyang seng ge dang zla ba'i steng na gnas pa'i sa bon h'um gi thig le las 'od zer sna tshogs spros nas khams gsum pa la reg ste /
translated: The blazing with various light rays and so on teaches the special seed syllable of the vajra, hum.

original: slar de nyid du bsdus la rdo rjer bsgom par bya bar ston to //🔽rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin du //
analyzed: slar de nyid du bsdus la rdo rjer bsgom par bya bar ston to // rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin du //
translated: This also teaches that one should meditate on the vajra from the drop of the seed syllable hum, which is located on the lion and moon seat, emanating various light rays, touching the three realms,🔽and gathering back into it.

original: bdag gi lus ni sprul bar bya //
analyzed: bdag gi lus ni sprul bar bya //
translated: One's body should be emanated as having the nature of Vajrasattva.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa bon h'um gi lte bar mtshon cing lha nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpar bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa bon h'um gi lte bar mtshon cing lha nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpar bskyed pa'o //
translated: This is the seed syllable HŪṀ, which is the center of the vajra, and the vajra is completely transformed by the blessing of the twenty-eight deities, and one generates oneself as Vajrasattva.

original: sku mdog la sogs pa ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sku mdog la sogs pa ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
